014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.BindMapFactory;
022
023/**
024 * Binds the entries of a {@code Map<String, Object>} to a SQL statement.
025 */
026@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
027@Target({ElementType.PARAMETER})
028@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(BindMapFactory.class)
029public @interface BindMap {
030    /**
031     * Prefix to apply to each map key. If specified, map keys will be bound as {@code prefix.key}.
032     * @return the prefix
033     */
034    String value() default "";
035
036    /**
037     * The set of map keys to bind. If specified, binds only the specified keys; any keys present in this property but
038     * absent from the map will be bound as {@code null}. If not specified, all map entries are bound.
039     * @return the map keys to bind.
040     */
041    String[] keys() default {};
042
043    /**
044     * Whether to automatically convert map keys to strings.
045     * If false, {@code Map} keys must be strings, or an exception is thrown.
046     * If true, any object may be the key, and it will be converted with {@link Object#toString()}.
047     * @return whether keys will be implicitly converted to Strings.
048     */
049    boolean convertKeys() default false;
050}
